title: Workshop on Mathematics Concept Visualization Instructional Design Through Children’s Personal Webpage Creation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic web development knowledge (HTML/CSS), mathematics education theories, and fundamental instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Capacity-building program for in-service mathematics teachers and educational planners to design web-based mathematics learning tools for children

learning_goals: Designing activities to visually represent mathematical concepts (e.g., fractions, geometry) using child-friendly web page templates.
Developing an assessment rubric to observe children’s creative problem-solving processes in unstructured learning environments.
Creating integrated math-technology lesson plans using web-based collaboration tools (e.g., Google Sites, Notion).

resources: Web Development Educational Software (Thimble, Wix EDU)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
